intro: Lindsaea dentata, commonly known as the toothed lindsaea, is a species of fern belonging to the family Bromeliaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds that are often adorned with small, tooth-like projections along the margins. Native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. Lindsaea dentata typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees and other structures in the canopy. Its botanical features make it a popular specimen among collectors and enthusiasts of tropical flora.
